intro: Minuartia piskunovii, commonly known as the Piskunov's sandwort, is a small, mat-forming flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and succulent leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
